source.name: Global AI Index
source.methodology: 5th edition. 83 countries ranked using 122 indicators from 24 data sources across 3 pillars (Implementation, Innovation, Investment) and 7 sub-pillars (Talent, Infrastructure, Operating Environment, Research, Development, Government Strategy, Commercial). Measures both Scale (absolute) and Intensity (relative to population/economy).
source.dataNote: Overall scores from published index. US=100 as benchmark. Sub-pillar scores estimated from published analysis and secondary reporting. Saudi Arabia confirmed #1 in Government Strategy sub-pillar.

countries.name: United States
countries.notes: Dominant leader, 27% of world's sophisticated AI experts, top compute infrastructure

countries.name: China
countries.notes: Strong in absolute capability, heavy AI infrastructure and talent investment

countries.name: Singapore
countries.notes: Asia's AI hub, leads in intensity/relative measures, top AI talent per capita

countries.name: United Kingdom
countries.notes: Strong AI talent pool and regulatory environment

countries.name: France
countries.notes: Debut in top 5, strong in open-source LLM dev (Mistral), public investment, computing

countries.name: Germany
countries.notes: Consistent climb since 2021, improving infrastructure and research

countries.name: Israel
countries.notes: Historically strong in innovation, rank dropped

countries.name: India
countries.notes: Top 10 entry, large AI workforce but brain drain challenges. Weak in compute and commercial investment.

countries.name: Saudi Arabia
countries.notes: #1 globally in Government Strategy sub-pillar due to massive announced spending commitments. Attracted top AI experts worldwide.

countries.name: Italy
countries.notes: #1 in Operating Environment sub-pillar. Weak in development and commercialization.
